attributes.action: Report to an NHS Hospital for Euthenasia !
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We would like the Prime Minister to volunteer to experience 'End of Life Care' in an NHS Hospital at his earliest convenience.  We would like him, as endorser of the 'End of Life Care Strategy/Liverpool Care Pathway' to experience the same treatment modes afforded the average British Senior Citizen (VIZ: covert DNAR note on records, accidental overdose of Midazolam to allow their practitioners to play the 'Best Interest/Futile Care' card and overdose them on morphine for non-existent pain, and/or infect them with CDiff or MRSA, whichever is easiest for him), to highlight the dangers of attempting to recover the cost of the Iraq War by allowing individual practitioners to decide when patients are at the 'End of Life'.

rejection.details: This petition makes no point about government policy.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
